alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 4:14AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Fort Bend, northern Brazoria and south central Harris Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 414 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Missouri City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Pearland, Sugar Land, Missouri City, Stafford, South Houston, Bellaire, West University Place, Midtown Houston, Downtown Houston, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, Second Ward, Neartown / Montrose, Greater Eastwood, Greater Fifth Ward, Greater Hobby Area, Greater Third Ward, Fourth Ward, University Place, First Colony and Astrodome Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Harris
